Key Match Events: Brendan Donovan hit a three-run homer
Iv√°n Herrera hit an RBI double in the sixth and scored on a throwing error by Yankees catcher Austin Wells following a wild pitch by Mark Leiter Jr.
Giancarlo Stanton hit a three-run double off the top of the center-field fence
Juan Soto doubled with two down. Following an intentional walk to Aaron Judge, Helsley fanned Wells on a slider for the final out
Post-Match Reflections: Oswaldo Cabrera struck out on a pitch-clock violation and Gleyber Torres flied out before Juan Soto doubled with two down. Following an intentional walk to Aaron Judge, Helsley fanned Wells on a slider for the final out.
Miscellaneous Highlights: It was the first victory for St. Louis in the Bronx since Tim McCarver hit a three-run homer in the 10th inning in Game 5 of the 1964 World Series and Bob Gibson pitched a complete game in a 5-2 win
Ryan Helsley became the first Cardinal to record a save in the Bronx since Ron Taylor pitched the final four innings of Game 4 of the 1964 World Series
